data.title: Beyond Taboos. Acantilados de Los Gigantes and El Teide from on High, Tenerife, Canary Islands, Spain
data.meta_description:
It seems that the name of the sleeping volcano El Teide goes back on the Guanche language once spoken by the inhabitants of Tenerife. Echeide means something like 'hell', but not in the Judaeo-Christian-Muslim sense of a place for the punishment of sinners. It's rather a word denoting a taboo; thus not permitting human beings to approach it. Something similar holds for the steep Los Gigantes cliffs in the foreground. Amazing basalt formations they are some 500 metres high. But I was above and beyond it all in a safe 737!
	The views were fabulous and I almost forgot I was a wee bit disappointed, too. In Classical Antiquity Tenerife went by the name Nivaria which means 'Snow Island' because the Teide was often white with snow. Not today...
data.text:
It seems that the name of the sleeping volcano El Teide goes back on the Guanche language once spoken by the inhabitants of Tenerife. Echeide means something like 'hell', but not in the Judaeo-Christian-Muslim sense of a place for the punishment of sinners. It's rather a word denoting a taboo; thus not permitting human beings to approach it. Something similar holds for the steep Los Gigantes cliffs in the foreground. Amazing basalt formations they are some 500 metres high. But I was above and beyond it all in a safe 737!

The views were fabulous and I almost forgot I was a wee bit disappointed, too. In Classical Antiquity Tenerife went by the name Nivaria which means 'Snow Island' because the Teide was often white with snow. Not today...
